question: A sum of 1600 Rs. gives a simple interest of 252 Rs. in 2 years and 3 months. The rate of the interest per annum is :
explanation:
Principal  = 1600 Rs. 
T = 2 years 3 months
$latex = \\left ( 2+\\frac{3}{12} \\right )yrs. = \\left ( 2+\\frac{1}{4} \\right )yrs.  = \\frac{9}{4}yrs.&s=1$
S.I = 252 Rs. 
R = % rate of interest per annum 
$latex => R = \\frac{100\\times S.I.}{P\\times t}&s=1$
$latex = \\frac{100 \\times 252}{1600 \\times \\frac{9}{4}} = 7\\%&s=1$
Rate of interest = 7% per annum
Hence option [C] is the right answer.
